title: Marvin Gaye
summary: Marvin Gaye (born Marvin Pentz Gay Jr.; April 2, 1939 â€“ April 1, 1984)[2] was an American singer and songwriter. He helped to shape the sound of Motown in the 1960s, first as an in-house session player and later as a solo artist with a string of hits, earning him the nicknames "Prince of Motown" and "Prince of Soul".
